text: Inducible binding to the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> serum response element during T cell activation is regulated by a phosphotyrosine - containing protein .
The proto-oncogene <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an immediate-early gene , and one of the first genes transcribed after stimulation of most cells with a variety of ligands .

text: <extra_id_0> Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression may be a pivotal event in converting ligand - receptor interactions at the membrane into functional modulation of cell phenotype .

The serum response element ( SRE ) in the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulatory region participates in induction of transcription by various growth factors and by phorbol esters and subsequent squelching of transcription .
We show that an inducible protein complex ( Band A ) binds to SRE DNA within 10 min after mitogenic stimulation of human PBL-T , and becomes nondetectable by 60 min .
Band A contains the serum response factor plus additional factor ( s ) .
A protein that is phosphorylated on a tyrosine residue in resting PBL-T suppresses binding of a component of Band A to the SRE motif .
Upon stimulation of the cells , this protein no longer prevents binding of DNA by Band A , and suppression of binding is restored within 30 min .
The phosphorylated tyrosine residue itself is important for the protein - protein interaction .
